relation: I feel very safe on campus. I walk and run a lot and I just play it smart.

Love it, love it, love it. I am not the typical sorority girl. I love my country life and getting dirty. This is way out of my comfort zone. But, the girls and guys I have meet are awesome. They are part of my new found family. They care and give so much. We do alot of community service and gives us to give back to the community that gives so much to the students here on campus.

It is the best cost effective college around. I love that if I take 12+ hours I pay the same as someone with 12 hours. So load up and pay a small amount. Your parents will love it. There are many scholarships available.

I love to just hang out and watch movies. There are several restaurants that have 1/2 place appetizers. There is bowling, paint balling, you name it they have it. The campus has several activities throughout the year to keep students busy and have fun and meet others.
There is every kind of food available for your taste buds. You won't go hungry on campus or off campus.
They want you to learn and work hard. But, the staff are always there to help if you ask for help. They really care.

Take every opportunity given to visit Pittsburg State University with your family. Attend the PITT CARE day events. Just take a trip and schedule a one-on-one campus visit. Talk with friends that might attend PITT. It is the most cost-effective college available. There are not many places you can go and make the same for 18 hours as you would 12 hours. There are many opportunities to join activities/clubs and give back to the community.
It has the most friendly faculty and community. There is always something happening on campus. There are many ways to meet other students and just hang out.

textAfterTable: Bang for the buck PSU is not very expensive when compared to numerous colleges, especially KU and K-State. Even with the lower costs, the experience is just as good. The academic programs are some of the best in their fields, especially in Kansas. Am enjoying being here I am enjoying PSU more than I could have imagined. I have made a ton of new friends. Campus is a lot of fun and there are many different student organizations to get involved in. Am learning a lot The general education classes are not particularly difficult, but they are filled with a lot of interesting information. My major is Biology/Pre-Physical Therapy emphasis. My core classes that go towards my major are pretty challenging and filled with new topics. As challenging as they may be, the instructors are very willing to help with any problems one is experiencing.
